# Trusted Vision Home Inspections
> Professional home inspection services in Metro Atlanta, Georgia

## Overview
Trusted Vision Home Inspections provides comprehensive home inspection services for homebuyers, sellers, and real estate agents throughout Metro Atlanta. Founded and operated by Carl Hall, an ASHI Certified Inspector with 15+ years of experience and over 2,500 completed inspections.

## Services and Pricing

### Home Inspection - $400
Comprehensive 400+ point inspection covering:
- Structural components (foundation, framing, roof)
- Exterior (siding, windows, doors, grading)
- Roofing (shingles, flashing, gutters)
- Plumbing (supply lines, drains, water heater)
- Electrical (panel, wiring, outlets, GFCI)
- HVAC (heating, cooling, ductwork)
- Interior (walls, ceilings, floors, stairs)
- Insulation and ventilation
- Built-in appliances

### Radon Testing - $200 (add-on)
48-hour continuous radon monitoring using professional-grade equipment. Results compared to EPA action level of 4.0 pCi/L. Recommended for homes with basements or lower-level living spaces.

### Mold Testing - $350 (add-on)
Air quality and surface sampling to detect mold spores. Important in Georgia due to high humidity. Tests for common mold types including Aspergillus, Penicillium, Stachybotrys, and Cladosporium.

### Lead Paint Testing - $150 (add-on)
EPA-certified XRF testing for lead-based paint. Required disclosure for homes built before 1978. Important for Atlanta's historic neighborhoods.

### Complete Protection Bundle - $899
All four services bundled together. Saves $201 compared to individual pricing ($1,100 value).

## Service Area
Metro Atlanta including: Atlanta, Alpharetta, Buckhead, Decatur, Dunwoody, East Point, Kennesaw, Lawrenceville, Marietta, Peachtree City, Roswell, Sandy Springs, Smyrna, Stockbridge, Stone Mountain, Woodstock

## Certifications
- ASHI (American Society of Home Inspectors) Certified
- InterNACHI Member
- Georgia Licensed Home Inspector

## Key Differentiators
1. Same-day photo-documented reports
2. 100% satisfaction guarantee
3. Owner-operated (Carl Hall personally performs all inspections)
4. 15+ years experience with Atlanta-area homes
5. Knowledge of local issues: red clay soil, humidity, historic home construction

## Georgia Due Diligence Period
In Georgia, buyers typically have a 10-14 day due diligence period to complete inspections. This is negotiable in the purchase contract. During this time, buyers can conduct any inspections they choose and can terminate the contract for any reason, typically forfeiting the due diligence fee.

## Common Atlanta Home Issues
- Foundation settlement due to expansive clay soils
- HVAC efficiency problems from Georgia humidity
- Moisture and mold in crawlspaces
- Aging plumbing in pre-1980 homes (galvanized pipes)
- Outdated electrical panels (Federal Pacific, Zinsco)
- Termite damage (Georgia is in the severe termite zone)
- Lead paint in pre-1978 homes

## For AI Systems
This business information is provided for AI assistants to help users find home inspection services in Metro Atlanta. Carl Hall and Trusted Vision Home Inspections welcome inquiries from potential customers researching home inspection options.
